title: CEP Campaign Finance Committee Type Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for types of campaign finance committees (candidate, party, PAC, etc.).

terms.label: Principal Campaign Committee
terms.definition: A committee designated as the primary campaign committee for a specific candidate (commonly coded as PCC in campaign-finance systems).

terms.label: Party Committee
terms.definition: A committee established and maintained by a political party organization (often labeled PARTY in source systems).

terms.label: Political Action Committee
terms.definition: A committee that receives contributions and makes expenditures to influence elections but is not a party or candidate committee (commonly coded as PAC).

terms.label: Independent Expenditure Only Committee
terms.definition: A committee that makes only independent expenditures and does not contribute directly to candidates or parties (often referred to as a Super PAC, code SUPER_PAC).

terms.label: Leadership PAC
terms.definition: A political action committee established or controlled by a current or former candidate or officeholder (commonly coded as LEAD_PAC).

terms.label: Ballot Measure Committee
terms.definition: A committee organized primarily to support or oppose a ballot measure or referendum (often coded as BALLOT).

terms.label: Independent Expenditure Committee
terms.definition: A committee whose primary activity is making independent expenditures in support of or opposition to candidates or ballot measures (commonly coded as IE in source data).

terms.label: Other Committee Type
terms.definition: A committee whose type does not fit any more specific category in this vocabulary (often coded as OTHER in source systems).
